text: The sub-atomic particles located in the nucleus of an atom are?
explanation:
The nucleus contains two types of subatomic particles, protons and neutrons.
The protons have a positive electrical charge and the neutrons have no electrical charge.
A third type of subatomic particle, electrons, move around the nucleus.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The IUPAC nomenclature of the structure is?
explanation:
Straight-chain hydrocarbon molecules that contain only singly-bonded carbons are called alkanes.
When naming these molecules, the final syllable in their name is "ane."
Find and name the longest continuous carbon chain.Identify and name groups attached to this chain.Number the chain consecutively, starting at the end nearest a substituent group.Designate the location of each substituent group by an appropriate number and name.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
SO\(_2\) + O\(_2\) → 2SO\(_3\)
In the reaction above, the most suitable catalyst is?
explanation:
During the Contact Process for manufacturing sulfuric acid, sulfur dioxide has to be converted into sulfur trioxide, which is done by passing sulfur dioxide and oxygen over a solid vanadium(V) oxide catalyst.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In the preparation of salts, the method employed will depend on the?
explanation:
The method used to prepare a salt depend on:
the solubility of the salt in water.
the heat stability of the salt
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The following non-metal form acidic oxides with oxygen except?
explanation:
The oxides which neither react with acids nor react with bases are known as neutral oxides.
Carbon monoxide neither reacts with acids nor reacts with bases.
Thus, carbon monoxide is a neutral oxide, produced when combustion reactions are not fully completed, either through lack of oxygen or due to low mixing
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: How many neutrons are present in atom with mass number and atomic number 37 and 17 respectively?
explanation:
The mass number = number of neutrons + atomic number.
number of neutrons = The mass number - atomic number.
number of neutrons = 37 - 17 = 20
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The sulphide that is commonly used in coating electric fluorescent tubes is?
explanation:
ZnS (Zinc Sulfide) screen was used because it emits a flash of light when struck by an alpha particle.
This is a phenomenon called Radio luminescence in which a flash of light is observed on the screen when acted upon by a radioactive substance.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: An organic compound which liberate carbon(iv)oxide from trioxocarbonate(iv) solution is likely to be?
explanation:
Carboxylic acids and enols react with sodium bicarbonate to liberate carbon dioxide.
E,g CH\(_3\)COOH
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Addition of sodium chloride to water to form a solution would  lead to?

options.A: increase in freezing point and increase the boiling point
options.B: increase in freezing point and decrease the boiling point
options.C: decrease in freezing point and decrease the boiling point
options.D: decrease in freezing point and increase the boiling point

explanation:
If you add salt to water, you lower its freezing point as well as raise its boiling point.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A chemical widely used as a fertilizer is?
explanation:
Calcium ammonium nitrate or CAN, also known as nitro-limestone or nitrochalk, is a widely used inorganic fertilizer.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: On the basis of the electrochemical series, which of these ions will show the greater tendency to be discharged at the cathode in an electrolytic cell
explanation:
The arrangement of elements in order of increasing electrode potential values is called electrochemical series.
K > Na > Ca > Mg > Al > Zn > Fe > Ni > Sn > Pb > H > Cu > Ag > Au.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Addition of charcoal to the filter bed of sand during water treatment for township supply is to?
explanation:
Activated Carbon filters are excellent at removing chlorine and related poor taste and odor.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Using the metal activity series, the metal that can liberate hydrogen gas from steam is?
explanation:
Iron reacts with steam to form iron oxide and hydrogen gas.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: An organic compound with fishy smell is likely to have a general formula?
explanation:
Amines possess a characteristic ammonia smell, liquid amines have a distinctive "fishy" and foul smell.
-Amine. R-NH2
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
N\(_2\)O\(_4\) ⇔ 2NO\(_2\)          (Δ = -ve)
From the reaction above, which of these conditions would produce the highest equilibrium yield for N\(_2\)O\(_4\)?
explanation:
high temperature and high pressure favor the highest yield for N\(_2\)O\(_4\)
high temperature favours the production of the reactant since it is endothermic, while high pressure favours the side involving a decrease in volume.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Zn + 2HCL → ZnCl\(_2\) + H\(_2\) 
What happens to zinc in the above reaction?
explanation:
-Zn is a reducing agent, HCl is an oxidizing agent.
-the zinc is oxidized
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: An organic functional group which can likely decolorize ammoniacal silver nitrate is?
explanation:
Terminal alkynes react with Tollens reagent (ammoniacal silver nitrate solution) to form silver alkynides as a white precipitate, whereas internal alkynes do not react with Tollens reagent.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A colored gas that is known to be poisonous and can readily damage the mucous lining of the lungs is?
explanation:
Chlorine is a yellow-green gas at room temperature. Chlorine has a pungent, irritating odor similar to bleach that is detectable at low concentrations.
Exposure to low concentrations of chlorine (1 to 10 ppm) may cause eye and nasal irritation, sore throat, and coughing. Inhalation of higher concentrations of chlorine gas (>15 ppm) can rapidly lead to respiratory distress with airway constriction and accumulation of fluid in the lungs (pulmonary edema).
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In order to electroplate spoon with silver, the arrangement of the electrolytic cell is?

options.A: the anode is a silver rod and the cathode is the spoon
options.B: the anode is the spoon and the cathode is a silver rod
options.C: the electrolyte is silver trioxonitrate(v)( solution and the cathode is a silver rod.
options.D: the electrolyte  is silver trioxonitrate(v) solution and the anode is the spoon

explanation:
The steel spoon to be coated with silver is the cathode of the electrolytic cell and the anode of the electrolytic cell is made of a silver metal
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: An organic compound which decolorizes bromine water is likely to be?
explanation:
If you shake an alkene with bromine water (or bubble a gaseous alkene through bromine water), the solution becomes colourless.
Alkenes decolourise bromine water.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Crude petroleum is converted to useful products by the process of?
explanation:
A process called fractional distillation is used in oil refineries to separate (as well as join or split) the various lengths of hydrocarbon chains to create different petroleum products from the different distillates.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: An organic compound contains 69% carbon, 15.3% hydrogen and 30.7% oxygen. Calculate the the empirical formula [C=12, H = 1, O = 16]

2H\(_2\) + O\(_2\) → 2H\(_2\)O
From the equation above, calculate the volume of unreacted oxygen gas if a mixture of 50cm\(^3\) of hydroden and 75cm\(^3\) of oxygen are involved
explanation:
Since 2 mol H\(_2\) reacted with 1 mol of O\(_2\)
: 50cm\(^3\) of hydrogen reacted with 25cm\(^3\) of oxygen
Remainder oxygen = Supplied amount - Reacted amount → 75cm\(^3\) - 25cm\(^3\)
= 50cm\(^3\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In which of the following will hydrogen form ionic compound?
explanation:
NaH is a saline (salt-like) hydride, composed of Na+ and H− ions.
NaH (sodium hydride) is considered an ionic compound because it is composed of a metal (sodium) and a non-metal (hydrogen), where sodium readily loses an electron to form a positive ion (Na+) and hydrogen gains an electron to form a negative ion (H-) creating an ionic bond between them.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If the volume of a given mass of a gas at 0ºc is 29.5cm\(^3\). What will be the volume of the gas at 15ºc, given that the pressure remains constant.
explanation:
Charles' law is a special case of the ideal gas law in which the pressure of a gas is constant.
Charles's law defines the direct relationship between temperature and volume.
GIVEN DATA: V\(_1\) = 29.5cm\(^3\),  V\(_2\) = ? ,  T\(_1\) = 0ºc or 273k,  T\(_2\) = 15ºc or 288k
\(\frac{V_1}{T_1}\) = \(\frac{V_2}{T_2}\)
V\(_2\) = \(\frac{V_1 x T_2}{T_1}\) → \(\frac{29.5 x 288}{273}\)
V\(_2\) = 31.1cm\(^3\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The reactions below represent neutralization reaction, in which of them is the value of ΔH highest?
explanation:
The enthalpy change of neutralisation involving weak acids are smaller in magnitude compared to that between strong acids and strong bases. This is because weak acids/bases are partially dissociated, which means not all hydrogen ions are free to react with hydroxide ions.
For strong acids and bases, the enthalpy of neutralisation values are always closely similar with the values -57 and -58 KJ/mol. We know that strong acids completely ionize in water. In case of weak acids, only partial dissociation of its ions occurs.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The pollutant usually presents in a city which generates its electricity from coal?
explanation:
In the majority of power plants, sulfur appears due to coal burning which is used to generate electricity.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The dehydration of CH\(_3\)CH\(_2\)CH\(_2\)CH\(_2\)OH will give?
explanation:
An alkene is produced when dehydration of alcohol is performed. Alcohol dehydration is an example of an elimination reaction which is quite the opposite of substitution reaction and addition reaction.
The products of the dehydration of a primary alkanol are water and an alk-1-ene (1-alkene).
Butanol gives a mixture of but-1-ene and but-2-ene when dehydrated.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: When heat is absorbed during a chemical reaction, the reaction is said to be
explanation:
An endothermic reaction is any chemical reaction that absorbs heat from its environment.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following best represent solid gas mixture?
explanation:
Solid in gas mixture: Smoke, ice clouds, dust.
Liquid in gas mixture: fog, mist, vapour and hair sprays.
Gas in solid mixture: aerogel, Styrofoam.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
H\(^+\) + OH\(^-\) → H\(_2\)O
The equation above illustrates
explanation:
A neutralization reaction is when an acid and a base react to form water and a salt and involves the combination of H+ ions and OH- ions to generate water.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Electrons enter into orbitals in order of increasing energy as exemplified by?
explanation:
Shells and subshells are filled in energy level order, so electrons will fill the 2p subshell before the 3s shell.
And the x subshell before the y and z.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Wrought iron is obtained by heating cast iron in a furnace with?
explanation:
Cast iron + haematite = wrought iron
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In the extraction of iron, hot air is introduced into the blast furnace through?
explanation:
Pre-heated air at about 600ºC is blown into the furnaces from the bottom through the tuyeres.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: How many bonding pair are present in carbon(iv)oxide?
explanation:
There are 4 bond pairs in CO₂ and no lone pairs are there.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: 2-methylprop-1-ene is a structural isomer of?
explanation:
Isomers of Butene: are But-1-ene, But-2-ene, 2-Methylpropene or 2-methylprop-1-ene
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Alkanes are used mainly?
explanation:
Alkanes are very useful as fuels.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: What volume of (dm\(^3\)) of water will be added to 10dm\(^3\) of 2.0 mol/dm\(^3\) HCL acid solution to give a final solution of 0.5 mol/dm\(^3\)?
explanation:
To make a fixed amount of a dilute solution from a stock solution,
use the formula:C\(_1\)V\(_1\) = C\(_2\)V\(_2\)
where:V\(_1\)= Volume of stock solution needed to make the new solution.
C\(_1\)= Concentration of stock solution.
V\(_2\)= Final volume of new solution.
C\(_2\)= Final  concentration of stock solution
2 * 10 = 0.5 * V2
20 = 0.5V2
\(\frac{20}{0.5}\) = V2
V\(_2\)= 40dm\(^3\)
What would be added = V\(_2\) - V\(_1\)
= 40 - 10 = 30dm\(^3\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

The above table shows the compositions of the atmosphere of planet X. Which of these gases are present in higher percentages on earth?
explanation:
The air in Earth's atmosphere is made up of approximately 78 percent nitrogen and 21 percent oxygen. Air also has small amounts of other gases, too, such as carbon dioxide, neon, and hydrogen.

text: Hard water is water with high concentrations of dissolved ions, in particular calcium and
explanation:
Hard water is water with high concentrations of dissolved ions, in particular calcium and magnesium ions
